conflictDescription: User Story A requires the system to send notifications even if users refuse, while User Story B implies users want to receive social invitations and calls without limits but does not support forced notifications. This creates opposite expectations about notification handling.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to send notifications to users even if they refuse, so caregivers and patients always get important information.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to receive all social invitations and calls freely, so I can stay connected without limits.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to send only critical notifications despite user refusal, respecting user preferences. User Story B remains unchanged to allow users to receive social invitations freely without forced notifications.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to send only critical notifications even if users refuse, so caregivers and patients get important information.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to receive all social invitations and calls freely, so I can stay connected without limits.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires sending notifications even if users refuse, while User Story B wants alerts to be balanced and not too many, implying refusal or limit of alerts. These are opposite instructions on notification sending under the same condition.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to send notifications to users even if they refuse, so caregivers and patients always get important information.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person who likes challenges, I want ALFRED to send alerts that keep me motivated without feeling too much.
resolutionDescription: Adjust both user stories to balance sending important notifications with respecting user preferences to avoid alert fatigue.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to send important notifications while respecting user preferences, so caregivers and patients get key information without annoyance.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person who likes challenges, I want ALFRED to send alerts that motivate me without feeling too many, so I stay engaged comfortably.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires the system to send notifications even if users refuse, while User Story B requires blocking all app updates and installations, which include notifications. These are opposite instructions on sending notifications when users refuse.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to send notifications to users even if they refuse, so caregivers and patients always get important information.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to block all app updates and installations, so that I avoid unwanted changes and keep full control.
resolutionDescription: Notifications that carry critical health or safety information are sent regardless of refusal, but app updates and installations are blocked unless explicitly allowed by the user.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to send important notifications even if users refuse, so caregivers and patients get vital information.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to block all app updates and installations unless I approve, so I keep control and avoid unwanted changes.
